intro: Espeletia idroboi, commonly known as the Idrobo's espeletia, is a rosette-forming plant native to the páramo ecosystems of Colombia. It is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage that helps retain moisture in the cold, high-altitude environment. The plant produces large, showy inflorescences with purple or pink flowers, which bloom during the warmer months. Its roots are adapted to anchor it in the rocky, nutrient-poor soils of its habitat. Espeletia idroboi plays an important ecological role in stabilizing soil and providing nectar for pollinators in its native range.
